text: Membrane - associated lymphotoxin on natural killer cells activates endothelial cells via an NF-kappaB - dependent pathway .

BACKGROUND : Inhibition of complement in small animal models of xenotransplantation has demonstrated graft infiltration with natural killer ( NK ) cells and monocytes associated with endothelial cell ( EC ) activation .
We have previously demonstrated that human NK cells activate porcine EC in vitro , which results in adhesion molecule expression and cytokine secretion .
In this study , we used the NK cell line NK92 to define the molecular and cellular basis of NK cell - mediated EC activation .

METHODS : EC were transfected with either reporter constructs containing the luciferase gene driven either by <extra_id_0> E-selectin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or <extra_id_0> interleukin (IL)-8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoters or a synthetic NF-kappaB - dependent promoter .

In addition , a dominant - negative mutant <extra_id_0> tumor necrosis factor receptor I <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> TNFRI <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) expression vector was co-transfected in inhibition studies .

text: Forty-eight hours after transfection , EC were stimulated with NK cells or NK cell membrane extracts for 7 hr and activation was measured by a luciferase assay .

RESULTS : Co-culture of NK cells with transfected EC enhanced <extra_id_0> E-selectin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> IL-8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and NF-kappaB - dependent promoter activity .

NK cell membrane extracts retained the capacity to activate EC and induced nuclear translocation of NF-kappaB ( <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) .

text: Western blotting of NK cell and membrane extracts detected the presence of <extra_id_0> Lymphotoxin-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> LTalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) but not <extra_id_0> tumor necrosis factor-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

text: Furthermore , <extra_id_0> LTalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was secreted in NK : EC co-cultures .

Co-transfection with dominant - negative mutant <extra_id_0> TNFRI <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> inhibited EC activation by NK cell membrane extracts and by NK cells by 80 % and 47 % , respectively .

text: The same pattern of inhibition was observed using anti-human LT sera .

CONCLUSIONS : Human NK cell membrane - bound LT signals across species via <extra_id_0> TNFRI <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , leading to NF-kappaB nuclear translocation and transcription of <extra_id_0> E-selectin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL-8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , which results in EC activation .

text: The discrepancy in the degree of inhibition by membrane extracts and NK cells with mutant <extra_id_0> TNFRI <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> suggests that additional pathways are utilized by NK cells to activate EC .
